definition: to sell/to make or carry out (a plan or intrigue etc)
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: There are separate ticketing booths for individual and group. Please use the correct line.
sentences.chinese: 團體與個人票售票口不同，請按需求排對窗口。

sentences.english: Those film fans were waiting at the ticket window.
sentences.chinese: 那些影迷們正在售票口等着。

sentences.english: I want to go downtown by bus and where is the ticket window?
sentences.chinese: 我想搭巴士去市中心，哪裏是售票口呢？

sentences.english: Tickets are now on sale at usual outlets.
sentences.chinese: 現在可以在普通售票口買到票。

sentences.english: This way, please, the ticket office will tell you the exact shuttle.
sentences.chinese: 請您跟我來，售票口會告訴您確切的班次。

definition: to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to bounce (a check)/to return a ticket/ticket refund
to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
to change one's reservation/to transfer to a different flight, airline, bus or train
